meanings.definition: Existing or occurring before a crisis.
meanings.sent1: The precrisis plan helped us be ready for any emergency.
meanings.sent2: It is important to have precrisis strategies in place to prevent chaos.
meanings.sent3: The precrisis meeting turned into a picnic when the alarm was false.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor was like a precrisis shield, protecting her from panic.
meanings.sent5: The precrisis calmness of the town was shattered by the sudden storm.

meanings.definition: Anticipating or preparing for a crisis.
meanings.sent1: The precrisis drills helped us practice our emergency response.
meanings.sent2: Being precrisis ready can save lives in times of trouble.
meanings.sent3: The precrisis preparations included stocking up on supplies and making a plan.
meanings.sent4: His precrisis mindset was like a superhero's, always one step ahead.
meanings.sent5: The precrisis vigilance of the team prevented a major disaster.
